Headline: More amenities eyed for Tondaligan Baywalk in Pangasinan – Manila Bulletin
Text: By Jerick Pasilao DAGUPAN CITY – Aside from bikers, more local tourists will get to enjoy the Tondaligan Beach Baywalk now that plans are afoot to add more amenities in the majestic area. Administrator Jhun Cadiz said aside from the bike lane and other water activities, they also plan to put up a planting area dedicated to “Plantitas and Plantitos”. “Inihahanda din natin ang Tondaligan para kapag tuluyan nang nagbukas ang turismo, mawe-welcome natin ang mga bisita dahil magkakaroon tayo ng amenities, grilling stations at water activities tulad ng jet ski at iba pa,” Cadiz told Manila Bulletin. While the baywalk is still incomplete, it is slowly becoming a place for bikers because of its 1.2-kilometer bike lane and a picturesque view of the Lingayen Gulf. The first phase of the project is meant for pedestrians and cyclists while the next phase will be for other planned attractions. “Sa pamamagitan nito, mabibigyan din natin ng pagkakataon ang iba na gustong magnegosyo at trabaho rito,” added Cadiz said. Based on the project, the Tondaligan Baywalk will be extended up to Barangay Bonuan Binloc to Barangay Bolasi all the way up to its adjacent San Fabian.
